intro: Quiina glaziovii, commonly known as the Glaziov's quiina, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
